names.pinyin: hu po er wu hu gao

actions: Relieves Fire toxicity, absorbs moisture and reduces swellings.
Activates the Blood, dissipates Stasis, r educes swelling and promotes healing.
Reduces swellings and treats abscesses and lesions.
Reduces swellings, induces ulceration and dispels putrefication.
Clears Heat, drains Fire and is used for burns and sores.
Clears Heat, drains Fire, resolves toxicity, alleviates itching, dissipates nodules and alleviates pain.

symptoms: Itching inside of the elbows and behind the knees
May have a history of allergies
May begin in infancy with red, weeping, crusted lesions on the cheeks and scalp then moves to the extremities
Usually abates by age three but reappears frequently throughout one's life
The itching is triggered by scratchy surfaces, humidity and environmental or psychological stress
Repeated scratching leads to lichenification of the skin
Secondary bacterial infections, dry skin and bleeding may occur with possible changes in color

contraindications: Do not use long-term. If there is no improvement after five days, discontinue use.

notes: Grind the ingredients into a fine powder and combine with petroleum jelly to form a paste. Apply once or twice daily.
